channel.title: Blog on worm
channel.description: Recent content in Blog on worm

item.title: Creatine Deep Dive
item.description: Hey, meatsuits. Most people should be taking creatine. Why? I think a better question is why not, but let’s give it a try. - improved power/strength (5-15%), work capacity, recovery - more lean mass gains cognitive benefits sleep deprivation tolerance possible recall improvements in certain populations possible benefits to a host of neurologic conditions and difficult to treat conditions like post-COVID fatigue, fibromyalgia relatively low cost for magnitude of benefit - one of the best “bang for your buck” supplements at around $0.

item.title: LDL & Mortality - Not as simple as we thought?
item.description: Interesting paper in the BMJ looking at the association between LDL levels and mortality in non-diabetic primary prevention patients. Primary prevention aims to prevent the onset of a disease or condition. This includes measures like vaccinations, healthy lifestyle promotion (diet and exercise), and smoking cessation programs. Secondary prevention focuses on early detection and treatment of a disease or condition to prevent it from worsening. Examples include regular screenings for cancer or cholesterol, and taking medication to manage high blood pressure.
